text.section:
Notwithstanding any other provision of this title, a person may not ride a bicycle or a motor scooter:
On any roadway where the posted maximum speed limit is more than 50 miles an hour; or
On any expressway, except on an adjacent bicycle path or way approved by the State Highway Administration, or on any other controlled access highway signed in accordance with § 21-313 of this title.

section.section: Where there is not a bike lane paved to a smooth surface, a person operating a bicycle or a motor scooter may use the roadway or the shoulder.
A person operating a bicycle or a motor scooter may not leave a bike lane until the movement can be made with reasonable safety and then only after giving an appropriate signal.
The Department shall adopt regulations pertaining to this subsection, including a definition of "smooth surface".

text.section: A motor scooter may not be operated at a speed in excess of 30 miles per hour.

Notwithstanding any other provision of this title, a person may not operate an EPAMD on any roadway where there are sidewalks adjacent to the roadway or the posted maximum speed limit is more than 30 miles an hour.
An EPAMD may not be operated at a speed in excess of 15 miles per hour.
